name: Aguadito
description: Peruvian green soup usually made with cilantro, carrot, peas, potatoes and can have chicken, hen, mussels or fish. It also contains ají amarillo (yellow chili pepper) and various other vegetables and spices. The green color is due to cilantro. It is known for having a potential for easing or alleviating symptoms associated with the hangover.<ref name="Barrell 2017">{{cite web  author=Barrell , Ryan  title=13 Hangover Cures the World Swears By  website=Paste  date=March 13, 2017  url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2017/03/13-hangover-cures-the-world-swears-by.html  access-date=July 30, 2017}}</ref>

name: Ajiaco
description: In the Colombian capital of Bogotá, ''ajiaco'' is typically made with chicken, three varieties of potatoes, and the ''Galinsoga parviflora'' herb commonly referred to in Colombia as ''guascas''.<ref name="mycolombian">{{cite weburl=http://www.mycolombianrecipes.com/ajiaco-bogotano-colombian-chicken-and title=Ajiaco Bogotano (Colombian Chicken and Potato Soup) publisher=Mycolombianrecipes.com date=2009-03-19 accessdate=2014-06-03}}</ref> In Cuba, it is a  hearty stew made from beef, pork, chicken, vegetables, and a variety of starchy roots and tubers classified as ''viandas''.<ref>{{cite weburl=http://www.tasteofcuba.com/ajiacocubano.html title=Cuban Ajiaco Recipe publisher=Tasteofcuba.com date= accessdate=2014-06-03}}</ref>

name: Acquacotta
description: Originally a Peasant foodspeasant food,<ref>{{cite book  url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Wz3iAgAAQBAJ&pg=PA67  title=The Italian Vegetable Cookbook  publisher=Houghton Mifflin Harcourt  author=Scicolone, Michelle  year=2014  pages=67  isbn=978-0547909165}}</ref> historically, its primary ingredients were water, stale bread, onion, tomato, olive oil<ref>{{cite book  url=https://books.google.com/books?id=1FVLv7WS4C4C&pg=PT190  title=Essentials of Classic Italian Cooking  publisher=Knopf Doubleday Publishing Group  date=2011  accessdate=12 September 2014  author=Hazan, Marcellaisbn=978-0307958303}}</ref> and any spare vegetables or leftovers. It has been described as an ancient dish.<ref>{{cite book  url=https://books.google.com/books?id=H_wJw4Zh2XEC&pg=PA103  title=The Tuscan Year: Life and Food in an Italian Valley  publisher=Macmillan  author=Romer, Elizabeth  year=1989  pages=103–104  isbn=0865473870}}</ref>

name: Analı kızlı soup
description: Bulgur meatballs and chickpeas in gravy with yogurt

name: Ash-e doogh
description: Consists of yogurt and leafy vegetables. Served hot.

name: Avgolemono
description: Chicken broth, rice or orzo (pasta)orzo, and lemon, thickened with tempered eggs

name: Avocado soup
description: Can be prepared and served as a cold or hot soup

name: Bacon soup
description: Bacon, vegetables, and a thickening agent. Pictured is celery and bacon soup.

name: Bak kut teh
origin: Indonesia, Malaysia <ref>{{cite journallast=Yoshinofirst=Kosakuyear=2010title=Malaysian Cuisine: A Case of Neglected Culinary Globalizationjournal=Globalization, Food and Social Identities in the Asia Pacific Regionpublisher=Sophia University Institute of Comparative Culturelocation=Tokyopage=4url=http://icc.fla.sophia.ac.jp/global%20food%20papers/pdf/2_4_YOSHINO.pdf }}</ref> and Singapore
description: Consists of meaty pork ribs simmered in a complex broth of herbs and spices (including star anise, cinnamon, cloves, ''Angelica sinensisdang gui'', fennelfennel seeds and garlic) for hours.<ref>Grêlé D, Raimbault L, Chng N. Discover Singapore on Foot. Select Publishing, 2007. page 158.</ref>

name: Bakso
description: Meatball noodle soup in rich beef broth, sometimes include bok choy, noodles, tofu, hard-boiled egg, fried shallots and wontons.<ref name="AP">{{cite news  url=http://www.nydailynews.com/life-style/eats/bakso-indonesian-meatball-soup-president-obama-loved-child-article-1.454324  title=Bakso: The Indonesian meatball soup President Obama loved as a child  newspaper=NY Daily News  date=November 18, 2010  accessdate=30 January 2015  agency=Associated Press}}</ref>

name: Barley
description: Barley, vegetables, and broth

name: Beef noodle soup
description: Stewed or red cookingred braised beef, beef broth, vegetables and Chinese noodles. It exists in various forms throughout East Asia and Southeast Asia, and is popular as a Chinese cuisineChinese and Taiwanese cuisineTaiwanese noodle soup.

name: Beer soup
description: Recipe from the middle ages using heated beer and pieces of bread;<ref>http://www.soupsong.com/rbeer1.html Recipe: DANISH BEER SOUP Bot generated title </ref> though other ingredients were also used.<ref>{{cite book url=https://books.google.com/books?id=8zKBmkw0kVIC&pg=PA22&dq=Beer+soup#v=onepage&q=Beer%20soup&f=false title=Wild women in the kitchen: 101 ... - Google Books publisher=accessdate=2009-09-26 isbn=9781573240307 last1=Alper first1=Nicole date=January 1996 }}</ref>

name: Bergen fish soup
description: White fish (haddock, halibut, cod) and various vegetables in a heavy cream

name: Binignit
description: Coconut milk, fruits and tapioca pearls, served hot but sometimes chilled

name: Bird's nest soup
description: Edible bird's nest, an expensive delicacy valued for its unusual texture

name: Borscht
description: Cabbage and beet-based soup with meat. Often eaten hot or cold. A national Russian, BelarusBelorussian, UkraineUkrainian and PolandPolish (without cabbage but with mushrooms, served on the Christmas Eve) dish.

name: Bouillabaisse
description: Fish soup

name: Bouillon (soup)
description: Sliced meat, potatoes, sliced cooking bananaplantains, yam, kelp, cabbage, and celery. Traditionally prepared on Saturdays

name: Bourou-Bourou
description: Vegetable and pasta

name: Bread soup
description: Stale bread in a broth

name: Brenebon
description: Kidney bean soup served in pig's trotters broth, spiced with shallot, garlic, salt, sugar, wikt:pepperpepper, nutmeg and clove. Mixed with chopped green beans, celery and scallion.

name: Brown veal
description: Veal

name: Brown Windsor soup
description: Lamb and muttonLamb or beef steak, parsnips, carrots, leeks, bouquet garni, Madeira wine; popular in England during the Victorian eraVictorian and Edwardian eras

name: Bun bo Hue
description: A noodle soup from central Vietnam, with beef.

name: Buridda
description: seafood soup or stew

name: Butajiru
description: Pork soup

name: Cabbage soup, kapusniak, kapustnica, zelnacka
description: Sauerkraut, meat

name: Caldillo de congrio
description: Conger eel heads,  garlic, onion, coriander, carrots, Black pepperpepper, chopped tomatoes, cream, boiled potatoes, and conger meat.

name: Caldillo de perro
description: Seafood, hake, garlic, olive oil, lemons, and Seville oranges.<ref name="Hopkinson2013">{{cite booklast=Hopkinsonfirst=Simontitle=Roast Chicken and Other Storiesurl=https://books.google.com/books?id=4RyZAAAAQBAJ&pg=PT112date=23 July 2013publisher=Hyperionisbn=9781401306144page=112}}</ref> It is customarily served with sour orange juice.

name: Caldo verde
description: Potatoes, thinly sliced kale, with slices of ''chouriço'' added before serving.

name: Callaloo
description: Taro leaf or other leafy greens, usually with pork or crab added for flavor. The greens referred to as callaloo vary from island to island depending on availability.

name: Canh chua
description: A fish soup from southern Vietnam, made sour with tamarind.

name: Canja de Galinha
description: Chicken, pasta and lemon, particularly popular in the states of Minas Gerais and Goiás

name: {{illCarp soupcsRybí polévka (Česko)}}
description: Carp's head and offal, onion and vegetable. Part of traditional Czech peopleCzech Christmas Eve dinner.

name: Carrot soup
description: Prepared with carrot as a primary ingredient, it can be prepared as a cream-style soup<ref name="HuffPost 2012"/><ref name="Creasy 2008"/> and as a broth-style soup.<ref name="ABC"/>

name: Cazuela
description: Clear broth, rice, potato, squash or pumpkin, corn and chicken or beef. Eaten in South America and Spain, it combines native and introduced ingredients. Pictured is an Ecuadorian ''cazuela''.

name: Chestnut bisque
description: Chestnut#CulinaryChestnuts are a primary ingredient

name: Chicken noodle soup
description: Chicken, stock, noodles, such as egg noodles

name: Chicken soup
description: Made from Chicken (food)chicken that's simmered with various other ingredients. Pictured is southern Chinese style chicken soup with mushrooms and corn.

name: Chicken vegetable soup
description: Chicken, stock, onion, green beans, carrots, potato

name: Chupe
description: Thin, milky seafood soup, also referred to as ''Chupe de Mariscos''

name: Chupe Andino
description: Refers to various soups and stews that are prepared in Andes Mountains region of South America

name: Cioppino
description: Fish stew with tomatoes and a variety of fish and shellfish (Italian-American)

name: Cock-a-leekie
description: Leek and potato soup made with chicken stock

name: Cold borscht / Šaltibarščiai
description: Beetroot (or sometimes tomato), popular in Eastern Europe. A Lithuanian specialty, usually made in summer time in one varietiy, almost always cold. Based on beets, usually served with either hot boiled or fried potatoes.

name: Corn chowder
description: Similar to New England clam chowder, with corn substituted for clams in the recipe

name: Crab bisque
description: Crab stock and heavy cream

name: Cream of apple soup
description: Granny Smith apples, stock, cream, spices

name: Cream of asparagus
description: Onions, asparagus, chicken broth, heavy cream

name: Cream of broccoli
description: Broccoli, stock, and milk or cream as primary ingredients

name: Cream of Chicken (food)chicken
description: Mass-produced in a condensed soup form, various non-commercial and homemade variations also exist

name: Cream of Crab
description: Pictured is Maryland cream of crab soup.

name: Cream of mushroom soupCream of mushroom
Crème Ninon
description: Cooking baseBase of a heavy Stock (food)stock purée of green peas and dry Champagne (wine)champagne

name: Cucumber soup
description: Cucumber soup is known in various cuisines.

name: Cullen skink
description: Smoked haddock, potatoes, onions and cream

name: Curry Mee
description: thin yellow noodles or/and string thin mee-hoon (rice vermicelli) with spicy curry soup, chile pepperchilli/sambal, coconut milk, and a choice of dried tofu, prawns, cuttlefish, chicken, egg (food)egg, mint leaves and  cockle (bivalve)cockle.

name: Dalithoy
description: Soup made with split yellow lentils and spices.  It is a Konkani staple that is often served over rice.

name: Dashi
description: Clear fish stock made with ''kombu'' (sea kelp) and ''katsuobushi'' (smoked bonito flakes). ''Dashi'' broth is often used as a base for miso soup and other Japanese soup broths.

name: Dillegrout
description: Chicken pottage made with almond milk, sugar, and spices traditionally presented at coronations of English monarchs by the lord of the manor of Addington PalaceAddington.<ref>{{Cite booklast=Clarksonfirst=Janettitle=Soup : a global historypublisher=Reaktionyear=2010isbn=978-1-86189-774-9location=Londonpages=113–114oclc=642290114}}</ref>

name: Duck soup noodles
description: The dish consists of ingredients such as duck meat in hot soup with mixed herbs and Chinese noodles#Rice basedBee sua served in particular at Penang hawker centres.

name: Egg drop soup
description: Savory soup made by pouring beaten eggs into swirling boiling water or broth

name: Egusi soup
description: Vegetable soup

name: Ezogelin soup
description: Savory soup made by red lentil, bulgur, onion, garlic, salt, olive oil, black pepper, hot pepper and peppermint

name: Fabada Asturiana
description: Dried large white beans (fabes de la Granja, soaked overnight before use), shoulder of pork (lacón) or bacon (tocino), black pudding (morcilla), chorizo, and saffron (azafrán)

name: Fanesca
description: Cod soup

name: Fish soup bee hoon
description: Seafood

name: Fisherman's Soup
description: Ηot and spicy river fish soup with a lot of hot paprika ({{lang-huHalászlé}})

name: French onion soup
description: Deep, rich broth made with onions and beef. Often topped with croutons and gruyere cheese melted golden on top, over the edges of the bowl.

name: Fruktsoppa
description: Dried fruit such as raisins and prunes

name: Fufu and Egusi soup
description: Vegetables, meat, fish, and balls of ground melon seed

name: Fish stock (food)Fumet
description: Fish stock, often concentrated and used as a base for sauces, and usually made with fish heads and bones

name: Garmugia
description: Primary ingredients include chicken or vegetable Stock (food)stock or broth, asparagus, artichoke hearts, fava beans, peas, onion and meats, such as pancetta and veal.<ref>{{cite book  url=https://books.google.com/books?id=RWSOVYWK2WoC&pg=PA63  title=Cucina Povera: Tuscan Peasant Cooking  pages=63 isbn=9781449402389  last1=Johns  first1=Pamela Sheldon  date=2011-09-13 }}</ref><ref>{{cite book  url=https://books.google.com/books?id=y_w-0C1mTXwC&pg=PA77  title=A Culinary Traveller in Tuscany  pages=77–78 isbn=9781892145680  last1=Elon  first1=Beth  year=2009 }}</ref>

name: Gazpacho
description: Pureed tomato and vegetables

name: Ginataan
description: Method of cooking using coconut milk. Due to the general nature of the term, it can refer to a number of different dishes, each called ''ginataan'', but distinct from one another.

name: Ginestrata
description: Thin, lightly spiced egg-based soup prepared with primary ingredients of egg yolks, chicken stock, and Marsala wine or white wine

name: Goat meat pepper soup
description: Common ingredients are goat meat,<ref name="Jideofo"/> crayfish, Uziza, Negro Pepper (also called Uda Ewentia or Enge) and nutmeg,<ref name="Asika-Enahoro"/> such as Calabash Nutmeg (also called Ehu or Ariwo).

name: Gogi guksu
description: Pork and noodle soup

name: Golden Mushroom
description: A variation of Cream of Mushroom Soup

name: Gomguk
description: Beef parts such as ribs, oxtail, brisket, ox's head or ox bones by slow simmering on a low flame. The broth of ''gomguk'' tends to have a milky color, with a rich and hearty taste.

name: GoulashGoulash soup
description: Beef, pork, paprika, peppers, tomato, potato, and onion. {{lang-hugulyas}} translates roughly as cowboy

name: Ground nut soup
description: PeanutGroundnuts, also known as peanuts

name: GukKimchi Guk
description: Kimchi soup

name: Gumbo
description: Louisiana Creole cuisineCreole soup from the American South, most popular in New Orleans. Often includes seafood, made with shrimp or crab stock and andouille sausage and thickened with a dark ''roux''.

name: Harira
description: Popular as a starter but is also eaten on its own as a light snack. There are many variations and it is mostly served during Ramadan, although it can be made throughout the year.

name: Hot and sour soup
description: Soups from several Asian culinary traditions. In all cases, the soup contains ingredients to make it both spicy and sour.

name: Íslensk Kjötsúpa
description: Meat soup made with lamb and vegetables

name: Soup joumouJoumou
description: Mildly spicy pumpkin soup made with pieces of beef, potato, plantains and vegetables such as parsley, carrots, green cabbage, celery and onions. It is eaten every first of January in honor of Haitian independence in 1804.

name: Kharcho
description: Lamb, rice, vegetables and a highly spiced bouillon

name: Kusksu
description: Kusksu is a traditional MaltaMaltese soup made primarily from seasonal Vicia fababroad beans, small pasta beads - known locally as kusksu - and fresh Ġbejnaġbejniet. Although similar is shape, kusksu pasta, which gives the soup its name, is "not to be confused with couscous".<ref>{{cite web url=https://www.visitgozo.com/blog/cooking-perfect-kusksu/ title=Cooking the perfect Kusksu! last= first= date= website= publisher=Visit Gozo access-date=April 29, 2019 quote=}}</ref>

name: Kwati (soup)Kwāti
description: Mixed soup of nine types of sprouted beans: black gram, green gram, chickpea, field bean, soybean, field pea, garden pea, cowpea, and rice bean

name: Laksa
description: A Peranakan cuisine.<ref>{{cite web url=http://www.citrusandcandy.com/2011/01/assam-laksa-king-of-malaysian-cuisine.html title=Assam Laksapublisher=Citrus and Candydate= January 24, 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news url=http://www.meemalee.com/2011/05/laksa-lemak-malaysia-gordons-great.html title=Laksa Lemak Recipe - Malaysia (Gordon's Great Escape)date= May 23, 2011 }}</ref>

name: La mianLagman
description: Pasta, vegetables, ground lamb and numerous spices

name: Leek soup
description: Leeks and often potatoes. Popular during St. David's Day. Pictured is leek and potato soup.

name: Lettuce soup
description: Lettuce is a primary ingredient.<ref name="Haedrich">{{cite book  url=https://archive.org/details/soupmakesmeal00kenh  url-access=registration  title=Soup Makes the Meal  publisher=Harvard Common Press  author=Haedrich, Ken  year=2001  pages=https://archive.org/details/soupmakesmeal00kenh/page/17 17–18  isbn=155832187X}}</ref> Some versions purée all of the ingredients together, and cream of lettuce soup is a type of lettuce soup.<ref name="Haedrich"/><ref>{{cite book  url=https://books.google.com/books?id=H8lwmA52ltIC&pg=PA160  title=Whole Food Facts: The Complete Reference Guide  publisher=Inner Traditions / Bear & Co  date=1996  accessdate=6 September 2014  author=Roehl, Evelyn  pages=160isbn=089281635X}}</ref>

name: Lentil soup
description: Red, green, or brown lentils. Popular in the Middle East and Mediterranean area.

name: Lobster stew
description: Cream or stock-based soup with chunks of lobster

name: Lobster Bisque (food)bisque
description: Lobster stock, heavy cream, and sherry

name: Log-log
description: Egg noodle soup (regional variants include ''Kinalas'', ''Batchoy'')

name: Lohikeitto
description: Salmon, potatoes (other root vegetables can be added such as rutabaga, carrots, onions), cream, and dill

name: Lung fung soup
description: Oriental Ratsnake{{elucidatedate=July 2015}} soup made with chicken, lemon, chili peppers, and Chinese vegetables

name: Lyvzha
description: Beef, potatoes, onion, garlic, carrots and thyme, etc.<ref>{{cite newslast=Plekhanovafirst=Zalinadate=27 May 2019title=How to increase a man's virility with the Ossetian soup: 'lyvzha'url=https://www.rbth.com/russian-kitchen/330410-how-to-increase-mans-virility-ossetian-soup-lyvzhawork=Russia Beyondaccess-date=21 June 2019}}</ref>

name: Maccu
description: Vicia fabafava beans is a primary ingredient

name: Manhattan clam chowder
description: Tomato-based clam chowder

name: Maryland crab soup
description: Vegetables, Callinectes sapidusblue crab, and Old Bay Seasoning in a tomato base

name: Matzah ball soup
description: Staple food on Passover. The Matzah ball dumplings are traditionally served in chicken broth with sliced carrots, garnished with chopped parsley. Matzo balls are also referred to as ''knaidel'' or ''knaedle''.

name: Melon soup
description: Soup prepared with melon as a primary ingredient. Pictured is a muskmelon soup.

name: Minestrone
description: Vegetables with noodles

name: Miso soup
description: ''Dashi'' stock base with dissolved miso paste (fermented rice, barley and/or soybeans). Common ingredients include tofu and seaweed.

name: Miyeok guk
description: Seaweed

name: Mohinga
description: Chickpea flour and/or crushed toasted rice, garlic, onions, lemongrass, bananabanana tree stem, ginger, fish paste, fish sauce, and catfish in a rich broth. Served with rice vermicelli.

name: Mulligan stew (food)Mulligan Stew
description: Improvised stew, typically made with whatever ingredients are available

name: Mulligatawny
description: Meat, vegetables, and spices. Based on an Indian sauce recipe.

name: Naengmyeon
description: Buckwheat noodles in a tangy iced beef broth, raw julienned vegetables, a slice of a Korean pear, and often a boiled egg and/or cold beef

name: Nettle soup
description: Tender shoots of the stinging nettle, popular in Scandinavia and eastern Europe

name: New England clam chowder
description: Bacon, ''mirepoix (cuisine)mirepoix'', clam juice and heavy cream, with other ingredients such as potatoes and chopped clams

name: Nikujaga
description: Meat, potatoes and onion stewed in sweetened soy sauce, sometimes with ito konnyaku and vegetables

name: Okra soup
description: Okra

name: Okroshka
description: Kvass-based vegetable and ham soup

name: Oxtail soup
description: Oxtail soup is made with oxtailbeef tails. The use of the word "ox" in this context is a legacy of nomenclature; no specialized stock of beef animals are used. At least five popular and unrelated versions of oxtail soup exist: a traditional Korean dish, a Chinese dish which is more like a stew, a fried/barbecued oxtail combined with soup variation which is a popular dish in Cuisine of IndonesiaIndonesia where it is called as ''sop buntut''. An ethnic dish of the American South which traces its lineage back to the pre-revolutionary war era, and a thick, rich, gravy-like soup popular in the United Kingdom since the 18th century. Louisiana Creole cuisineCreole oxtail soup is made from a tomato base with oxtails, potatoes, green beans, corn, Mirepoix (cuisine)mirepoix, garlic, and herbs and spices. In Germany, there are lots of varieties of oxtail soup (called ''Ochsenschwanzsuppe'' or ''Ochsenschleppsuppe'') usually containing oxtail, various root vegetables, herbs, and also Sherry or Madeira.

name: Palm nut soup
description: Palm kernel

name: Panada
description: Bread soup made with leftover bread, egg (food)eggs, beef broth and Parmigiano-Reggiano Cheese.<ref name="happystove.com">{{cite web url=http://www.happystove.com/recipe/68/Panada+(Bread+Soup) title=Panada recipe }}</ref>

name: Panadelsuppe
description: Made with broth, bread rollsrolls and eggs

name: Pasta fagioli
description: Chicken stock, pasta and vegetables.

name: Pea soup#CanadaYellow pea soup
description: Pea soup, originating with French settlers in Canada. Also called "French-Canadian pea soup"

name: Peanut soup
description: Made from peanuts, popular in African cuisine. Pictured is peanut soup (left) with fufu.

name: Philadelphia Pepper Pot
description: Beef tripe pepper soup

name: Phở
description: Staple noodle soup made by simmering Bone marrowmarrow-rich beef leg bones and knuckles with star anise, cinnamon, clove, cardamom, coriander, fennel, charred ginger, and charred onion to create the broth, served with rice noodles and various meats. ''Pho Dac Biet'', or "Special Combination" Pho, usually includes rare beef slices, beef balls, tripe, and flank meat. Pho is garnished to taste with thai basil, squeezed lime, jalapeños, bean sprouts, and sometimes culantro. Sriracha and hoisin sauce are also popular additions. Chicken, seafood and vegetarian varieties also exist.

name: Pickle soup
description: Various types of Picklingpickled vegetables, dill pickle soup is a variety of pickle soup prepared with pickled cucumber.<ref name="WCA">{{cite book  url=https://books.google.com/books?id=adO88lhxff4C&pg=PA333  title=What's Cooking America  pages=333 isbn=9781560447924  last1=Stradley  first1=Linda  last2=Cook  first2=Andra  date=March 2000 }}</ref> Pictured is kidney and pickle soup with barley (rassolnik).

name: Pork blood soup
description: Thai cuisine;<ref>{{cite news  url=http://www.laweekly.com/squidink/2014/07/09/where-to-find-khao-soi-the-excellent-thai-noodle-dish-youre-not-ordering  title=Where to Find Khao Soi, The Excellent Thai Noodle Dish You're Not Ordering  newspaper=LA Weekly  date=July 9, 2014  accessdate=7 September 2014  author=Gordon, James}}</ref> one version is called ''tom lueat mu''. Also a part of Chinese cuisine, and was consumed by laborers in Kaifeng "over 1,000 years ago".<ref>{{cite book  url=https://books.google.com/books?id=mz9r_eg3LDoC&pg=PA30  title=Offal: A Global History  pages=30 isbn=9781780231341  last1=Edwards  first1=Nina  date=June 2013 }}</ref>

name: Pozole
description: Pork or chicken meat and broth, hominy, onion, garlic, dried chiles and cilantro, in a thick, hearty soup

name: Psarosoupa (ψαρόσουπα)
description: Oil-and-lemon sauce, vegetables, rice, and salt-water fish

name: Pumpkin
description: Pumpkin cream soup may contain some green pepper (Italian), red bell pepper, onion, salt and some oil. ''Rucola'' leaves top the soup.

name: Ramen
description: Fresh or dried noodles in a variety of broths with a variety of toppings such as various meats like pork or lobster, onion and other various herbs (miso), and sometimes even corn

name: Rasam
description: Broth made in various ways using different spices and tamarind

name: Rassolnik
description: Dill pickle soup. It usually contains groats, such as pearl barley, rice or oatmeal, potatoes, greens and herbs. It is either vegetarian or more commonly made with meat (often offal, such as kidney).

name: Rawon
description: A beef stew in black ''Pangium edulekeluak'' soup that originated from Surabaya, East Java.

name: Rishtay / Rqaq o Adas
description: A whole lentil soup made with hand cut wheat noodles (similar to linguine) and flavored with fried garlic.

name: Rumford's Soup
description: Simple soup prepared with barley or barley meal and dried peas as primary ingredients that was utilized to feed impoverished people.<ref>{{cite book  last=Kellogg  first=D.O.  last2=Baynes  first2=T.S.  last3=Smith  first3=W.R.  title=The Encyclopædia Britannica: New American supplement. A-ZUY  publisher=Werner  series=The Encyclopædia Britannica: A Dictionary of Arts, Sciences, and General Literature. Original 9th Ed. in 25 Vols  year=1903  url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Su8hAQAAMAAJ&pg=PA673  accessdate=January 24, 2015  page=673}}</ref>

name: Saimin
description: Fresh, soft, undried egg noodles in bonito fish or shrimp broth with Chinese, Japanese, Filipino, Hawaiian, Korean, and Portuguese influences

name: Salmorejo
description: Tomato soup with garlic and bread crumbs

name: Sambar (dish)Sambar
description: Sambar, also spelt sambhar, is a lentil-based vegetable stew or chowder based on a broth made with tamarind popular in South Indian and Sri Lankan Tamil cuisines, adapted in each to its taste and environment.

name: Samgyetang
description: Chicken ginseng soup made with glutinous rice, jujubes, chestnuts, garlic, and ginger

name: Sayur Asem
description: Vegetable soup, sour and spicy

name: Sayur Lodeh
description: Vegetables stew in coconut milk based soup.

name: Scotch Broth
description: Mutton, barley, and various vegetables

name: Shark fin soup
description: Shark's fin, nearly tasteless, an expensive delicacy valued for its unusual texture

name: Shchav, sorrel soup, green borscht, green shchi
description: Sorrel soup in Polish, Russian, Ukrainian and Yiddish cuisines. In some recipes, sorrel is replaced by spinach or garden ''orache''.

name: Shchi
description: Cabbage soup, a national Russian dish

name: Seafood chowder
description: Salmon, mussels, shrimp, and scallops in a cream base

name: She-crab soup
description: Blue crab meat and crab roe

name: Shrimp bisque
description: Shrimp (food)Shrimp

name: Sliced fish soup
description: Fish, prawns, and vegetables

name: Snert
description: Thick pea soup, eaten in the winter, traditionally served with sliced sausage

name: Solyanka
description: Pickled cucumbers, sausages, smoked meat, fish or mushrooms, olives

name: Sop saudara
description: Spicy beef soup contains bits of beef and offals (usually fried cow's lungs), rice vermicelli, ''perkedel'' (fried potato patty) and hard boiled egg.<ref name=tv>{{cite newsauthor=Usmantitle=Wisata Kuliner Makassar: Menikmati Sop Saudara Dan Ikan Bandeng Bakar Khas Pangkepurl=http://www.makassartv.co.id/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=7389&catid=3&Itemid=56access-date=2016-05-09archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160305045032/http://makassartv.co.id/index.php?catid=3&id=7389&itemid=56&option=com_content&view=articlearchive-date=2016-03-05url-status=dead}}</ref>

name: Sopa de Gato
description: Simple soup, typically includes water, bread, oil, garlic, and salt

name: Soto (food)Soto
description: Rich soups based on various spice pastes, broths and sometimes coconut milk, often named by their originating region. ''Soto'' usually features numerous garnishes, including sprouts, sambal, crackers, fritters, and sometimes noodles.

name: Soto ayam
description: Spicy shredded chicken soup with noodles and a variety of garnishes which may include bean sprouts, boiled egg, green onions, fried onion flakes, chili sauce, compressed rice cakes, ''melinjo'' nut crackers and potato fritters.

name: Soup alla Canavese
description: White Stock (food)stock, tomato puree, butter, carrot, celery, onion, cauliflower, bacon fat, Parmesan cheese, parsley, Common sagesage, salt, and black pepperpepper

name: Soup Number FiveSoup No. 5
description: The main ingredient of this dish are the bull's testes or/and penis, other ingredients include lemongrass, thai chili peppers, green onion, ginger, onions, garlic and fish sauce.

name: Sour cherry soup
description: {{lang-humegyleves}}. Sour cherries, sour cream

name: Sour rye soup, white borscht, żur
description: Made of fermentation (food)soured rye flour (akin to sourdough) and meat (usually boiled pork sausage or pieces of smoked sausage, bacon or ham)

name: Sour soup (fish soup)
description: Rice, fish, various vegetables, and in some cases pineapple. The term also refers to various soups in a number of national cuisines.

name: Spinach soup
description: Prepared using spinach as a main ingredient

name: Split pea
description: Dried peas, such as the split pea. It is, with variations, a part of the cuisine of many cultures. It is greyish-green or yellow in color depending on the regional variety of peas used; all are cultivars of ''PeaPisum sativum''.

name: Stone soup
description: Pork meat products (such as black ''chouriço'', common ''chouriço'' and bacon), red beans, and coriander

name: Sup Kambing
description: Goat meat, tomato, celery, spring onion, ginger, candlenut and lime leaf, its broth is yellowish in color

name: Stracciatella (soup)Stracciatella
description: Made by drizzling a preparation based on beaten eggs into boiling meat broth while stirring.

name: Swedish fruit soup
description: Typically prepared using dried fruits, and typically served as a dessert dish. It may be served hot or cold.<ref>{{cite book  last=Marrone  first=T.  title=The Beginner's Guide to Making and Using Dried Foods: Preserve Fresh Fruits, Vegetables, Herbs, and Meat with a Dehydrator, a Kitchen Oven, or the Sun  publisher=Storey Publishing, LLC  year=2014  isbn=978-1-60342-927-6  url=https://books.google.com/books?id=fgEQAwAAQBAJ&pg=PA313  page=313}}</ref>

name: Taco soup
description: Similar ingredients to those used inside a taco: ground beef, tomatoes, chopped green chilis, olives, onions, maizecorn, beans, and a packet of taco seasoning.<ref>{{Citation  last = Crider    first = Kitty    title = Flavors of traditional foods can make some tasty soups  newspaper = The Spokesman-Review   page = 33   date = 29 January 2003  url =https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=EWZWAAAAIBAJ&sjid=kvIDAAAAIBAJ&pg=6846,5434048&dq=taco-soup&hl=en accessdate = 18 April 2012}}</ref> Vegetarian versions combine beans with the other ingredients, except for the ground beef.<ref>{{Citation  title = Taco Soup Has A Flavorful Combination  newspaper = The Mount Airy News (Mount Airy, North Carolina)  page = 9   date = 18 October 1995  url =https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=lnRAAAAAIBAJ&sjid=3lcMAAAAIBAJ&pg=5282,2195689&dq=taco-soup&hl=en  accessdate = 18 April 2012}}</ref>

name: Talbina
description: Talbina is a soup made from barley flour, formed by adding milk and honey to the dried barley powder. It is called talbina, which comes from the Arabic word laban meaning yogurt (milk/fermented churned milk), because of its resemblance to yogurt, as it is soft and white.

name: Tāng Fěn
description: Rice noodles in broth, usually beef, chicken, or custom broth

name: Tāng miǎn
description: Egg noodles in broth, usually beef, chicken, or custom broth

name: Tarator
description: Yogurt and cucumbers

name: Tarhana
description: Fermented grain and dairy

name: Tekwan
description: Fishcake or fishballs, jicama and mushroom soup in savoury broth. Specialty of Palembang city.

name: Tinola
description: Chicken, sliced green papayas, malunggay

name: Tom Yum
description: Lemongrass, galangal and kaffir lime leaf, fish sauce and lime juice in the broth, often garnished with shrimp/seafood (''Tom Yum Goong''), straw mushrooms, hot chili peppers, and cilantro.

name: Tomato bisque
description: Tomatoes and heavy cream; basil can be added to create tomato basil bisque

name: Tomato soup
description: Tomato is the primary ingredient. Also popular in many countries, including Hungary ({{lang-huparadicsomleves}}) and Poland ({{lang-plpomidorowa}})

name: Tongseng
description: A sweet and spicy goat meat soup, specialty of SurakartaSolo, Central Java.

name: Tortilla soup
description: Fried corn tortilla pieces submerged into a broth of tomato and other ingredients.

name: Tteokguk
description: ''Tteok'' (rice cake) soup

name: Turkey soup
description: Turkey stock and meat, vegetables (typically onions, carrots, celery), broad egg noodles or rice

name: Ukha or yushka
description: Various types of fish, vegetables, lime, dill, parsley, and black pepper

name: Vegetable soup
description: Vegetables as a primary ingredient

name: Vichyssoise
description: Creamy potato and leek soup, served with chives

name: Vori vori
description: Balls of corn flour and cheese, often with chicken

name: Waterzooi
description: Stew made with fish (traditional) or chicken

name: Wedding soup
description: Green vegetables, meat, chicken broth

name: Wine soup
description: {{lang-huborleves}}. Pictured is a wine soup with bread

name: Winter melon
description: Winter melon, filled with stock (usually chicken stock), vegetables, and meat, which has been steamed for a few hours

name: Zuppa pavese
description: Consists of broth into which fried slices of bread and poached eggs are placed. It is usually served with grated cheese.<ref>Elizabeth David, ''Italian Food'', 1954, p. 53</ref>
